task_summary: Place the brown/orange object onto the table surface, releasing it gently and retreating after placement. If the object is not already in the gripper, first detect and grasp it.

task_long_description.overview: A UR-style manipulator operates over a white table with several items (bottles, cans, blocks). The goal is to place down the brown/orange object visible on the right side of the workspace. The tree first verifies whether the object is already in the gripper; otherwise it performs a quick detectâ€“grasp routine. After confirming a stable grasp, the arm moves above the table, executes a low-force surface placement, opens the gripper to release, then retreats to clear the object and avoid collisions.
preconditions: Workspace is clear of obstacles except the visible items
stepwise_plan: Check if the brown object is already held.
If not held: detect, open gripper, compute grasp pose (top), grasp, verify stability.
Move above the table to a safe pre-place height.
Place on the table with minimal press force and neutral yaw.
Retreat to a safe distance and pause briefly.
success_criteria: Brown object ends stably on the table surface
Gripper released and robot clear of the object
failure_and_recovery: Detection fails: retry detect step via higher-level re-invocation
Unstable grasp: re-open, re-grasp with same pose key
Contact too early: retreat slightly and reattempt place
Timeout during movement: re-plan motion and retry sequence
task_long_description.termination: Terminate after successful release and retreat wait period.

frame_3.now_evidence: First clear contact/engagement near the brown object with grasp pose alignment.
frame_3.predicts_next: Initiation of grasp followed by transfer toward the table area.

node_specs.description: Checks if the specified object is currently held.
Vision detection of the brown object.
Compute a top-down grasp pose and store to blackboard.
Move to a safe pre-place height above the table.
Place the held object onto the table with low press force.
Back off from the placed object.

failure_modes: Early contact or collision while placing
recovery_strategy: Re-open and re-grasp using same pose key
Retreat slightly and reattempt placement with lower press force
Increase timeout bins and reissue motion
assumptions: The 'brown object' corresponds to the orange/brown item on the right of the table in the frames.
Frames suggest the object may already be in the gripper; the BT therefore includes a verification-first fallback before a minimal pick routine.
Placement target is the table surface near the right area.

expected_success_criteria: Object visible resting on table after release
No large disturbances to nearby items
Robot ends in a safe, non-contact configuration
